title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Argentina

description.narrative: The advisor is providing technical assistance to the Superintendencia de Seguros de la Nacion (SSN) in the area of insurance supervision. The advisor is expected to PCS to Buenos Aires at end of April or early May 2018.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability - Argentina

description.narrative: The Budget and Financial Accountability Team has partnered with the Argentine Ministry of Hacienda through an intermittent technical assistance project to develop the next generation of open budget and fiscal transparency tools. The Budget and Financial Accountability Team will provide ongoing technical assistance to the Argentine MOH functional and technical team in its efforts to provide detailed government financial and non-financial data to the public via its current web sites.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes - Argentina

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to improve the Government of Argentina's (GoA's) ability to identify, detect and prosecute money laundering, terrorist financing, and other financial crimes. Project activities will focus on (1) improving the FIU's ability to conduct core functions and act as the interagency coordinators for AML/CFT for the GoA; (2) enhancing risk-based AML/CFT supervision of the financial and non-financial sectors; and (3) improving financial investigative and prosecutorial authorities' ability to prioritize and pursue financial investigations and prosecutions, including as relates to asset forfeiture.

Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes -Argentina

description.narrative: Assist the Government of Argentina (GoA) stakeholders in the development of their anti-money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) regime, to include supporting the effectiveness of the financial intelligence unit; enhancing risk-based AML/CFT supervision of the financial system; and improving money laundering case development.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - Argentina

description.narrative: This project will provide advice to help strengthen the institutional capacity of Argentinas newly created Public Private Partnership (PPP) Unit, which resides in the Ministry of Finance. The potential pipeline of PPP projects in Argentina is very large, with an initial pipeline of 100+ projects with investment of $50+ billion, reflecting a backlog of infrastructure needs accumulated over more than ten years. Objectives include: Training and professional development of staff; assist staff in writing policies, guidelines and manuals for PPP structuring in risk allocation, standards for evaluation and procurement; develop guidelines for best practices; and support government institutions at various levels that have limited experience with PPPs.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt & Infrastructure Finance - Argentina

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to support increased private investment in infrastructure in Argentina, which is key to achieving and sustaining domestic economic growth, by fostering a more transparent, attractive investment environment. Project activities will focus on: 1) clarifying the process for structuring infrastructure projects, including from a regulatory perspective and for individual projects and 2) assisting contracting agencies during project planning and bidding, including building staff capacity to manage and oversee infrastructure project development and execution.

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to support increased private investment in infrastructure in Argentina, which is key to achieving and sustaining domestic economic growth, by fostering a more transparent, attractive investment environment. Project activities will focus on: 1) clarifying the process for structuring infrastructure projects, including from a regulatory perspective and for individual projects and 2) assisting contracting agencies during project planning and bidding, including building staff capacity to manage and oversee infrastructure project development and execution.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Argentina

description.narrative: Assistance to La Administracin Federal de Ingresos Pblicos (AFIP) will develop the functions of its Employee Integrity Unit and improve its capacity for internal audit and investigations, with the aim of rooting out corruption in revenue administration. The engagement emphasizes anticorruption measures involving expertise in inspector general functions. Specific corruption deterrent measures include training investigators and auditors in handling internal controls, auditing IT systems security of confidential taxpayer information (and providing recommendations for system upgrades), and creating whistleblower support pathways. In 2020, the project will expand to support AFIP audit capacity, through implementation of a Quality Review Staff (Q.R.S.) in the general audit unit, and through advancement of the international auditor corps' handling of transfer pricing cases.
